intro: Aldama fusiformis, commonly known as the fusiform aldama, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, with woody stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are yellow and are arranged in clusters, producing small seeds that are dispersed by the wind. Aldama fusiformis is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
